The New York State Ubuntu Local Community (LoCo) Team is a group of volunteers united by a commitment to Ubuntu and free and open source software (FOSS). The team advocates and supports Ubuntu for home, business, and educational use in New York State. By bringing the freedom of choice, power of the community, and stability of Ubuntu to the public, the team believes it can change the face of computing for the better. 
<<BR>>

=== Roadmap ===
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <tablestyle="float:right; font-size: 0.9em; margin: 0 0 1em 1em;" style="padding:0.5em;border: none;":><nowiki>[[File:NewYorkTeam/Events/20101120b/nyscate03.jpg|a workshop attendee takes a close look at a System76 netbook|width=300]]</nowiki>
|-
| <style="padding:0.5em;border: none;":><nowiki>[[File:NewYorkTeam/Events/20110122/IMG_1455.JPG|Carl helps a guest get Ubuntu and Skype working|width=300]]</nowiki>
|}

* Support Ubuntu locally
** Support existing New York state GNU/Linux user groups
*** SYRLUG - Syracuse
*** LUGOR - Rochester
*** Ithaca Free Software Association - Ithaca
** Partner with local computer user groups to assist with events
*** Rochester Computer Society Inc
*** FOSS @ RIT - Rochester
*** Free Software Advocates - Ithaca (Cornell)
*** Tech Age - Brighton
** Hold educational sessions open to the public
** Host and assist with GNU/Linux install fests
* Support Ubuntu at the state level
** Assist New York State Ubuntu users with finding:
*** Local GNU/Linux groups
*** Local computer retailers that support Ubuntu and GNU/Linux
* Ubuntu Activism
** Advocate for the adoption of Ubuntu by:
*** Individual users and families
*** Schools
*** Libraries
*** Businesses
*** Senior centers
** Assist local computer retailers with adopting Ubuntu
** Educate local computer retailers and consultants about Canonical partner programs
* Assist our members grow in the global Ubuntu community
** Help our members find Ubuntu teams that align with their personal interests
<<BR>>
